page.title: 09Farming in the vicinity.
page.content: The Salvation Army's Colony Farm is 388 ha. of which 63% is arable with crops of{wheat,barley,peas,potatoes & {oilseed rape. 270 cattle}are grazed on the slopes of Hadleigh Downs:170 for fattening and rest for breeding. The smaller farms north of Hadleigh are mainly devoted to{horses,}although Cooks Farm also grows{strawberries} harvested under the "pick your own" system. North of Belfairs Park exist a few farms of less than 3 ha. where horses are stabled and grazed. Apart from Brook Farm, all these farms also graze/stable horses belonging to private owners providing facilities for the considerable number of horse riders in the locality. Cross Farm, west of Hadleigh is an {abattoir}selling meat both wholesale and retail.
